answers.answer: Hi!Ferritin could be high in many cares, and if it is 1000ng/L or more (probably the 110 signifies this in another unit—could be mg/L) then it is probably hemochromatosis.Alcoholism, some types of anemia and thalassemia too can raise the ferritin levels very high. A high ferritin level with normal iron saturation is seen in conditions like  alcoholic or infective liver disease, chronic inflammatory disease such as arthritis or asthma, hypothyroidism, and type 2 diabetes. Discuss with your doctor and run tests to rule these out.MCV can be high in hemolytic anemia, pernicious anemia, vitamin B12 and/or folic acid deficiency, and in alcoholism. Since iron is high it can be due to hemochromatosis.Please consult your PCP for primary examination followed by proper referral to a hematologist. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.
